text: (WIND BLOWING)

WALDER FREY: You're wondering
why I brought you all here.
After all, we just had a feast.

Since when does old Walder
give us two feasts
in a single fortnight?
(CHUCKLING)

Well, it's no good
being Lord of the Riverlands

if you can't celebrate
with your family.
That's what I say.
(CHEERING)

I've gathered every Frey
who means a damn thing

so I can tell you my plans
for this great house
now that winter has come.
But first, a toast!
-FREYS: Aye!

No more of that
Dornish horse piss.

This is the finest Arbor gold,
proper wine for proper heroes!

-FREYS: Yeah!
-(LAUGHTER)
Stand together.
FREYS: Stand together!
Not you.

I'm not wasting good wine
on a damn woman.

Maybe I'm not
the most pleasant man.
I'll admit it.

But I'm proud of you lot.
You're my family.

The men who helped me slaughter
the Starks at the Red Wedding.

-(CHEERS)
-WALDER: Yes.
Yes, cheer.
Brave men, all of you.

Butchered a woman
pregnant with her baby.

Cut the throat
of a mother of five.

Slaughtered your guests after
inviting them into your home.

-(COUGHING)
-WALDER: But...

You didn't slaughter
every one of the Starks.
(CHOKING, HEAVING)

WALDER: No, no.
That was your mistake.

You should have ripped them
all out, root and stem.
(COUGHING, CHOKING)

Leave one wolf alive,
and the sheep are never safe.
(PANTING)

When people ask you
what happened here,
tell them the North remembers.

Tell them...
winter came for House Frey.
♪ (DRAMATIC MUSIC BUILDS) ♪
